main event: A journalist on the roof of the WYAT TV tower in Portsmouth, Virginia observed a cigar-shaped, dull silver or gray object on August 15, 1965.
interesting points: The object appeared in the northern sky, descended straight down to a low altitude near a TV tower, and then 'zoomed away' after being observed for 30-40 seconds.
The object was estimated to be 30-50 feet high, about the size of a grapefruit held at arm's length.
The observer was a journalist with the U.S. Coast Guard, who had been contacted by private UFO investigation groups about the sighting.
The weather conditions were clear with 7 miles of visibility and no cloud cover or thunderstorms.
The sighting occurred in an area with a lot of air traffic and a nearby military air traffic control facility.
sighted object: cigar-shaped, dull silver or gray object
witnesses: journalist with the U.S. Coast Guard
